physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Scattered shallow atrophic scars and hyperpigmentation located on the forehead, glabellar, preauricular, and periorbital areas. The remainder of the physical examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The rash in the patient faded over 6 months but never completely resolved. After 6 months of therapy with hydroquinone 4% cream and tretinoin 0.025% cream, there was significant improvement in the dyspigmentation, although the atrophy persisted.
